option.name: title_text
option.value: Any Questions? A Guide to Asking HOT Questions

string_table.name: pxabnsnfns10111100101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Welcome to this presentation on asking HOT questions. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click next to continue." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Benjamin Bloom’s Taxonomy of Learning comprises six levels of thinking that contribute to the learning process. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="These levels of learning are often arranged in a pyramid of learning. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="At the bottom of this pyramid are the lower order thinking skills, which include remembering, understanding, and applying. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="At the top, are the higher order thinking skills, or HOT skills, which include analyzing, evaluating, and creating.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Our goal is to ask questions that reach the top portion of this pyramid and encourage students to think critically instead of asking questions with yes or no answers. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click next to continue. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block /> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Complete the learning pyramid by typing in the levels of Bloom’s Taxonomy in the text boxes. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click submit to check your answer." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Drag and drop the verbs to the correct levels of Bloom’s Taxonomy. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click submit to check your answer." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Hover over the levels to view verbs associated with each. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click next. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Drag and drop the verbs to the correct levels of Bloom’s Taxonomy. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click submit to check your answer." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Hover over the levels to view question stems for each. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click next. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Drag and drop the levels of Bloom’s Taxonomy to the appropriate question. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click submit to check your answer. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Use the Google Doc to create your own HOT questions using the question stems and verbs.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then try to identify the level of your peers’ questions and provide feedback using the commenting feature.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Finally, scroll down to the bottom and create a new page. Write a short paragraph outlining a plan describing how you can implement HOT questions into your next class. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Then click next to continue. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Span Text="Thank you for completing this presentation. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="If you have any questions, contact instructional designer Mike Stein. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="
" /> </Block> <Block> <Span Text="Click Exit to exit this presentation. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
